duties_responsibilities.duty: Carve out the vision and foster growth of the organization, nurturing partnerships and championing its endeavors in the public sphere.

Provide effective leadership, respecting the unique contributions of each member, and work with the board and committees to engage in supporting and advocating for the organization’s work and community priorities.
Supervise the administration of the center, direct oversight of community advocates, and provide direction and support to board members and partner organizations.
Develop and maintain relationships with community stakeholders, clients, and funders to seek advice, build trust, and seek participation.
Prepare and manage budgets, ensuring the optimal allocation of resources to support the organization’s goals and objectives.
Identify and engage potential funding sources, lead fundraising efforts, and oversee reporting to funders as required.
Constantly seek opportunities for program expansion through thorough research and analysis.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration or a related field (Master's preferred)
Certification and special knowledge/skills related to program administration
